persistence
Class Broker<E extends BusinessObject>

java.lang.Object
  persistence.Broker<E>
Direct Known Subclasses:
EmployeeBroker, PermissionBroker
public abstract class Broker<E extends BusinessObject>
extends java.lang.Object

All brokers should inherit this class. Includes database information for multiple db connectivity, BrokerThreads and associated methods for fetching results from the database and managing the threads.

Version:
0.3.0
Author:
Daniel Kettle, Daniel Wehr

Nested Class Summary
private  class Broker.BrokerConMonitor
          Class to monitor a list of db connections for each broker, closing them when they are old and unused within a certain time period (default is 5 minutes) to prevent overuse of memory.
 
Field Summary
private  Broker.BrokerConMonitor bcon_mon
          Monitor thread for checking broker objects that are inactive, unused and consuming memory needlessly.
private  utilities.DoubleLinkedList<DBConnection> connections
          Double linked list for holding connection objects.
private static int int_min_connections
          Minimum connections for Broker object, must be 1 or higher to be valid.
private  boolean runConnectionThread
          Boolean used to determine if the BrokerConMonitor should continue to run.

Field Detail

connections

private utilities.DoubleLinkedList<DBConnection> connections
Double linked list for holding connection objects. List changes dynamically depending on the need of the application, old connections will be closed and removed periodically.

bcon_mon

private Broker.BrokerConMonitor bcon_mon
Monitor thread for checking broker objects that are inactive, unused and consuming memory needlessly.

int_min_connections

private static final int int_min_connections
Minimum connections for Broker object, must be 1 or higher to be valid. This prevents NullPointerExceptions when all connections are removed from the DoubleLinkedList.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

runConnectionThread

private boolean runConnectionThread
Boolean used to determine if the BrokerConMonitor should continue to run.

Method Detail

create

public abstract boolean create(E createObj)
                        throws DBException
Accepts a newly made object, and creates its equivalent record within the database. TODO An exception will be thrown if there is already a record in the database with the same primary key.

Parameters:
createObj - The object to add to the database.
Returns:
true if the create was successful, otherwise false.
Throws:
DBException

get

public abstract E[] get(E getObj)
                                        throws java.sql.SQLException
Retrieves data from the database and return them as objects.

Parameters:
getObj - A newly created object used to determine what will be returned. All non-null attributes will be used as search criteria. If the primary key is filled in the search object, only that will be used and all others will be ignored.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

update

public abstract boolean update(E updateObj)
                        throws DBException
Applies all changes to the updated object to its equivalent record within the database. The updated object must have originally been retrieved from the database. TODO An exception will be thrown if the record to be updated does not exist in the database.

Parameters:
updateObj - The previously retrieved object that has been updated.
Returns:
true if the update was successful, otherwise false.
Throws:
DBException

delete

public abstract boolean delete(E deleteObj)
                        throws DBException
Removes the record from the database that is equivalent to the given object. The object to be deleted must have originally been retrieved from the database. TODO An exception will be thrown if the record to be deleted does not exist in the database.

Parameters:
deleteObj -
Returns:
true if the delete was successful, otherwise false.
Throws:
DBException

parseResults

public abstract E[] parseResults(java.sql.ResultSet rs)
                                                 throws java.sql.SQLException
Parses a ResultSet returned by a select query back into cachable objects. The original search must have used a "SELECT *" so that full employee objects are in the ResultSet.

Returns:
An array of cachable objects.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException
